Description: Marble frog sitting on base (square at the front, bent at the back following contours of frog); fountain spout. Left front leg broken off and missing; damage at right elbow and knee and at both eyes. Hollowed out interior leading to round spout hole; two holes broken out in breast; traces of plaster adhering to base and front of base and in groove indicating frog's mouth. Large-grained white marble.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Allard Pierson Museum, Amsterdam. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Acquired by von Bissing, recorded as coming from 'Kum Gaief'.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CB.54) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: v. Bissing S.484 (Other Accession Number)
